page.title: 10WADWORTH SCHOOL
page.content: {Wadworth school}was known to have existed between 1814 to 1816.In 1840 a new school was built, part of which was a house for the headmaster. As time went on they converted the house into a classroom for the infants. In 1872 a new school masters house was built. Up to 1886 the infant part had its own mistress in charge, after that date both sections were united under the master. Up till 1891 all the children in the school paid one penny towards their education.In 1904 the West Riding took over the management and in 1942 it ceased to be a Church of England school. In 1973 the school moved to modern buildings on the South East edge of the village. The old building was sold by the church, it had been agreed it should be returned to them if it stopped being a school, and became the community centre.
